meanings.definition: Absence or failure of development of a particular organ or tissue.
meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed the baby with agenesia of the heart.
meanings.sent2: The agenesia of her teeth caused her dental problems.
meanings.sent3: The plant's agenesia of leaves made it look like a stick figure.
meanings.sent4: His agenesia of creativity hindered his ability to paint.
meanings.sent5: The agenesia of stars in the sky made the night seem empty.

meanings.definition: Congenital absence of an organ or tissue.
meanings.sent1: The genetic condition caused agenesia of the lungs in the newborn.
meanings.sent2: Her agenesia of the kidney required regular medical check-ups.
meanings.sent3: The doll's agenesia of hair gave it a unique bald look.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned house had an eerie agenesia of windows.
meanings.sent5: The agenesia of trees in the forest created a barren landscape.
